description.narrative: In Nigeria, maternal and child health is a priority initiative for the country. According to UNICEF, every single day Nigeria loses about 2,300 under-five year olds and 145 women of childbearing age. Although poor mobile coverage and the need for resilient connectivity make satellite the only viable means of providing reliable internet connectivy in many rural regions, it is crucial to demonstrate to local partners on the ground that the technology can be effective in providing relevant and effective downstream applications. This Nigerian Maternal Health project follows on from the ' I-Sat Nigeria' project, this follow on project has increased satellite solution previously deployed to expand access to its health applications across two new states.
Expanding access to essential maternal and child health information for staff and patients
